title: Empowering Medical Equipment Sustainability in Low-Resource Settings: An AI-Powered Diagnostic and Support Platform for Biomedical Technicians
summary: This research introduces an AI-powered diagnostic and support platform designed to enhance medical equipment sustainability in low-resource settings. The system integrates a large language model (LLM) with a user-friendly web interface to provide real-time, step-by-step troubleshooting guidance for biomedical technicians and imaging technologists, aiming to reduce device downtime and improve healthcare delivery.

title: 3D Molecule Generation from Rigid Motifs via SE(3) Flows
summary: This paper introduces a novel SE(3)-equivariant generative model for de novo 3D molecule generation that operates on rigid molecular motifs (fragments) instead of individual atoms. This fragment-based approach achieves comparable or superior performance to state-of-the-art atom-based methods, particularly in atom stability on the GEOM-Drugs benchmark, while significantly reducing generation steps and data representation size.

title: Domain-invariant Mixed-domain Semi-supervised Medical Image Segmentation with Clustered Maximum Mean Discrepancy Alignment
summary: This paper introduces a novel domain-invariant mixed-domain semi-supervised segmentation framework designed to address the challenges of scarce annotations and significant domain gaps in medical imaging, where data originates from multiple unknown sources. The proposed method integrates a Copy-Paste Mechanism for data diversity and a Clustered Maximum Mean Discrepancy (CMMD) block for domain-invariant representation learning within a teacher-student framework. It demonstrates robust and precise medical image segmentation performance, outperforming existing semi-supervised and domain adaptation techniques on Fundus and M&Ms benchmarks, even with very few labeled examples.
domains: Cardiovascular Imaging (Cardiac MRI, implied by M&Ms benchmark)
